current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text: To require the Attorney General to report on State law penalties for certain child abusers, and for other purposes.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

short-title.#text: Kilah Davenport Child Protection Act of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

term.#tail: means each of the 50 States, the District of Columbia, and each territory of the United States.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall publish and submit to  the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Committee on the Judiciary of the Senate

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: a report on the penalties for violations of laws prohibiting child abuse in each State, including whether the laws of each State provide for enhanced penalties when a victim of child abuse suffers serious bodily injury, or permanent or protracted loss or impairment of any mental or emotional function.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Committee on the Judiciary of the House of Representatives

text.#text: Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this Act, and again 3 years thereafter, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , is amended by inserting ‘‘, or against a child of, or in the care of, the person committing the offense’’ after

header.#text: Expansion of predicate for increased penalties for certain domestic assaults

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 S1778 IS: Kilah Davenport Child Protection Act of 2013
